title: Luxury retail segment growth in the United Kingdom ( UK ) 2008 to 2018
summary: The given chart is of multi-line type with 2 lines namely Luxury segment, and All retail. The y axis represents Revenue in billion U.S. dollars and the x axis represents Year.
Overall All retail is gradually increasing, Luxury segment is roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of Revenue in billion U.S. dollars in descending order is: 1. Luxury segment, and lastly, 2. All retail.
Overall across the Year, Luxury segment mostly maintained the highest Revenue in billion U.S. dollars when compared to others with a mean value of 24.4, and it peaked at 2013-2018.
The botommost line, All retail,  has a mean of 9.5, and peaked at 2013-2018.

max_summary: The given chart is of multi-line type with 2 lines namely Luxury segment, and All retail. The y axis represents Revenue in billion U.S. dollars and the x axis represents Year.
Overall All retail is gradually increasing, Luxury segment is roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of Revenue in billion U.S. dollars in descending order is: 1. Luxury segment, and lastly, 2. All retail.

Throughout the period, Luxury segment generally had the highest Revenue in billion U.S. dollars relative to others with an average of 24.4, and it reached its maximum at 2013-2018 with a value of 24.8.
All retail mostly had the least Revenue in billion U.S. dollars with a mean value of 9.5, which peaked at 2013-2018 with a value of 11.9.
The difference of Revenue in billion U.S. dollars between Luxury segment and All retail is smaller at Year 2013-2018 compared to the Year 2008-2013.
